籤詩版本二:
Etiquette and courtesy when entering and exiting Tibet
Words must be loyal and trustworthy must be obeyed
The mind is unclear and quiet
The bright red sun is in the middle
詩意: This hexagram represents the image of the red sun shining in the sky. Everything goes as planned.
解曰: There is nothing in mind. The autumn water is clear. No need to doubt. Things happen naturally.
籤詩故事一:
◇Taoyuan sworn brotherhood
At the end of the Eastern Han Dynasty, the world was in chaos, and the Yellow Turban thieves were causing chaos everywhere.
Liu Bei, Guan Yu and Zhang Fei, three people with lofty ideals, had the same ideals and depended on each other in their words and deeds for the ideal of doing a great cause together. They chose a season when the peach blossoms were in full bloom. They became sworn friends over wine, swore an oath to heaven, shared hardships, shared hardships, shared blessings, and jointly realized the beautiful ideal of reviving the Han Dynasty. The three became sworn brothers. It was March and the peach blossoms were in full bloom. It was commonly known as "Three Brothers in the Peach Garden".
聖意:
Jiazhai Qingji.
Peace of mind.
Seeking wealth is empty.
Trading is difficult.
Marriage.
Liujia is in danger.
Pedestrians block.
Field silkworms are unfavorable.


The six animals are in decline.
Searching for people is stagnant.
Litigation loss.
Migration. Conservatism.
Lost things.
Diseases are provided.
Good luck in the mountain tomb.
